result.execSummary:
The defendant Beatrice Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Beatrice Johnson
parties.address: 1806 N Martin Luther King Dr, Milwaukee, WI 53205

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Consider monitoring through the Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes: Cooperate with the Department. Take all prescribed/any medications.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Brian F. and write letter of apology.
Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens.
If not on disability, seek / maintain employment.

Court ordered defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments; from bail on deposit with balance due over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample pay surcharge from bail on deposit with balance due over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against defendant. If sample previously on file, surcharge waived.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting .

defendant.name: Johnson, Beatrice

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Invoice forwarded to accounts payable on the amount of $750.00 to Dr.Pankiewicz for services on June 2, 3, 4, 5, 2014. Copy in file.

Defendant Beatrice Johnson in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction-straight time, with credit for 13 DAYS time served.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Cooperate with the Department
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens
-If not on disability, seek / maintain employment
-No contact with Brian F and write letter of apology
-Take all prescribed any medications
-Consider monitoring thru mental health unit.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments from bail on deposit with balance due over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample pay surcharge from bail on deposit with balance due over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  If sample previously on file, surcharge waived.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Beatrice Johnson in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 34.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Beatrice Johnson in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Epps unavailable, matter rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Beatrice Johnson in court with attorney Jeff Schwarz for Louis E Epps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned to allow counsel to appear.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw
6/7/14 from Dr. Pankiewicz.  kmw
Order for Examination.  kmw

Defendant Beatrice Johnson in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of the client. Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 6/4 at 11am as to the special plea. Order For Examination under 971.16, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.
Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 34.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

14RM023190  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-30-2014

Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Stipulation to a bail modification is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.
Court orders bail amended to $250 CASH.

Defendant Beatrice Johnson in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Beatrice Johnson in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brian F.

Defendant Beatrice Johnson in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Beatrice Johnson in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
